challenge.challengeTitle: Create variables and assign a values. Concatenate a string with a number
challenge.challengeDescription: Declare multiple variables without assigning values. Assign different types of values (string, number, boolean) to variables and print them. Write a function that converts a string containing a number to an actual number using the appropriate equality operator

Convert a decimal number to a binary representation.

Build a product catalog system for an e-commerce platform. Define variables representing product names, prices, and categories. Initialize them with sample data. Demonstrate different data types for product information.

Write a script that validates user inputs in a form. Check for undefined and null values, and provide appropriate error messages for missing or incomplete data.

Create a math library that provides constants like pi and e. Declare these constants as const variables and use them in mathematical calculations throughout the library. Declare a constant variable PI and assign the value of the mathematical constant Ï€ (pi). Use it to calculate the circumference of a circle given its radius. Print the result.

Develop a configuration manager for a web application. Use const to define configuration settings that should remain constant during the application's lifecycle, such as API endpoints and default values.

Build a physics simulation application. Declare constants for physical quantities like the speed of light, gravitational constant, and Planck's constant. Use these constants in simulations and calculations. Declare a constant variable SPEED_OF_LIGHT and assign the value of the speed of light in meters per second (299,792,458 m/s). Use it to calculate the time it takes for light to travel a certain distance.
Design a unit conversion utility. Declare constants for conversion factors between different units, such as length, weight, and temperature. Ensure these constants cannot be modified during runtime.
Create a global configuration object for a multi-module application. Define const variables to hold parameters shared across the application, such as authentication settings and API keys.

Define a constant variable MAX_USERS and set its value to 100. Use it in a function that simulates user registration. If the number of users exceeds MAX_USERS, display a message indicating that registration is closed.
Create a constant variable SECONDS_PER_MINUTE and set it to 60. Write a function that converts minutes to seconds using this constant. Test the function with various values.
Imagine you're building an application that interacts with an external API. Declare a constant variable API_KEY and assign it a sample API key string. Use it in your API requests for authentication.
Declare a global variable outside of any function and a local variable inside a function. Print both variables within and outside of the function to observe their scope behavior.
Write a function that uses a block-level variable declared with the let keyword. Access this variable both inside and outside of the block to demonstrate block-level scope.
Create a nested function that references a variable from its parent function's scope. Illustrate how the scope chain works by accessing the variable from within the nested function.
Declare a variable inside a function and another variable with the same name outside of any function (global scope). Print both variables and explain how JavaScript handles variable naming conflicts.
Implement a function within another function. Declare a variable in the outer function's scope and try to access it from the inner function. Explain the concept of lexical scope.
Create a scenario where a local variable has the same name as a global variable. Demonstrate how the local variable takes precedence within its scope, hiding the global variable.
Develop a closure that accesses variables from its parent function's scope. Showcase how closures retain access to variables even after the parent function has completed execution.

Declare a variable x and initialize it with a value. Write a function that tries to access the variable before it's declared within the function. Explain the concept of variable hoisting and the expected behavior.
Declare a function multiply that takes two parameters and returns their product. Call the function before it's declared and explain how function hoisting allows this behavior.

Inside a block of code (using curly braces), declare a variable y and initialize it with a value. Print the value of y within the block and outside of the block. Explain the behavior of block-level hoisting.
Create a code snippet that demonstrates the dangers of using global variables. Show how global variables can lead to unintended side effects and how to avoid them using local scope.
Write a program that calculates the area of different shapes. Refactor the program by separating the area calculation logic into individual functions for each shape.

Write a function calculateArea that calculates the area of a rectangle. Call the function with incorrect parameters and explain the error message that occurs.

allChallenges.title: Anagram checker, palindrome checker, Word Search Game
allChallenges.content: Create a function to check if a given string is a palindrome or an anagram of another string (uses the same characters but rearranged). Create a Word Search game where users have to find words in a grid of letters using nested loops.

allChallenges.title: Magic 8-Ball app
allChallenges.content: Implement a Magic 8-Ball app that provides random answers to yes-or-no questions using a switch statement.

allChallenges.title: Tic-Tac-Toe
allChallenges.content: Build a dynamic Tic-Tac-Toe game with AI that uses if/else statements to determine the next move.

allChallenges.title: Infinite Scroll feature
allChallenges.content: Build a dynamic Infinite Scroll feature that loads more content as the user scrolls using a while loop and event listeners.

allChallenges.title: E-commerce product gallery
allChallenges.content: Create an e-commerce product gallery where users can view a list of products with images, names, prices, and ratings. Implement filters to allow users to sort and search for specific products based on various criteria.

allChallenges.title: Virtual Art Gallery
allChallenges.content: Develop a virtual art gallery where users can explore and interact with famous artworks. Allow users to click on paintings for detailed information and a zoomed-in view.

allChallenges.title: Interactive Storytelling
allChallenges.content: Create an interactive storytelling experience where users can make choices that affect the outcome of the story. Implement branching narratives and engaging plot twists.

allChallenges.title: Virtual Pet
allChallenges.content: Design a virtual pet simulation where users can adopt and take care of virtual pets. Implement features like feeding, playing, and monitoring their health.

allChallenges.title: Travel Planner
allChallenges.content: Develop a travel planner app that helps users plan their trips. Allow users to input their destinations, travel dates, and preferences, and provide them with a personalized itinerary.

allChallenges.title: Language Learning Game
allChallenges.content: Create a language learning game where users can practice vocabulary and grammar in a fun and interactive way. Include quizzes, word associations, and pronunciation exercises.

allChallenges.title: Escape Room Game
allChallenges.content: Design a virtual escape room game where users must solve puzzles and riddles to find their way out of a virtual room.

allChallenges.title: Time Management Tool
allChallenges.content: Develop a time management tool that helps users track and manage their daily tasks, set reminders, and visualize their productivity.
